cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (potential – not yet named in this advisory)
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north to north-northeast toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to sweep northeast across the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just west of Morgan City, Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – watches begin east of Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings extend from east of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and metro New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and far western Florida Panhandle coastlines
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely – most guidance shows 2–4 inches or less at Port Arthur, TX
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No – guidance for adjacent coast west of Morgan City shows 1–2 ft
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (gusts 20-30 mph) but tropical-storm winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible mainly east of Sabine Pass; not expected to exceed 3 ft at Port Arthur
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals, mainly Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado threat remains east of the track, therefore minimal for Port Arthur
